description: Number of orbits of length n under the map whose periodic points are counted by A000364.
comments: The sequence A000364 seems to record the number of points of period n under a map. The number of orbits of length n for this map gives the sequence above.
references: Yash Puri and Thomas Ward, A dynamical property unique to the Lucas sequence, Fibonacci Quarterly, Volume 39, Number 5 (November 2001), pp. 398-402.
links: Y. Puri and T. Ward, Arithmetic and growth of periodic orbits, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 4 (2001), #01.2.1.
formula: If a(n) is the n-th term of A000364, then the n-th term is u(n) = (1/n)* Sum_{d|n}\mu(d)a(n/d)
example: u(3) = 20 since the conjectured map whose periodic points are counted by A000364 would have 1 fixed point and 61 points of period 3, so it must have 20 orbits of length 3.
author: Thomas Ward (t.ward(AT)uea.ac.uk), Mar 13 2001
